briefdescription.para: Runs the basic file existence checks. Checks for paused simulations and file existence.
Checks that the folders exist and the files required for the simulation also exist.
Sets the map object with the correct variables, taking the SimParameters structure defined elsewhere for the parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Requires that parameters have already been imported into the SimParameters
This function can only be run once, otherwise a Main_Exception will be thrown

briefdescription.para: Imports the maps into the forestmap object.

detaileddescription.para: The simulation variables should have already been imported by setParameters(), otherwise a Fatal_Exception will be thrown.

briefdescription.para: Imports the activity maps from the relevant files.
Counts the number of individuals that exist on the spatial grid.

simplesect.para: the number of individuals that will be initially simulated

briefdescription.para: Sets up the dispersal coordinator by linking to the correct functions and choosing the appropriate dispersal method.
Contains the setup routines for a spatial landscape. It also checks for paused simulations and imports data if necessary from paused files. importMaps() is called for importing the map files.

xrefdescription.para: For values of dispersal, forest transform rate and time since historical (and any other double values), they will not be correctly outputted to the SIMULATION_PARAMETERS table if the value is smaller than 10e-6. The solution is to implement string output mechanisms using boost::lexical_cast(), but this has so far only been deemed necessary for the speciation rate (which is intrinsically very small).

briefdescription.para: Fill the active, data and grid objects with the starting lineages.

parameterdescription.para: the number of individuals expected to exist

simplesect.para: the number of lineages added (for validation purposes)

memberdef.argsstring: (const long &x, const long &y, const long &x_wrap, const long &y_wrap, const double &current_gen)
memberdef.name: getIndividualsSampled

briefdescription.para: Gets the number of individuals to be sampled at the particular point and time. Round the number down to the nearest whole number for numbers of individuals.

parameterdescription.para: the x location for individuals to be sampled
the y location for individuals to be sampled
the number of x wraps for the cell
the number of y wraps for the cell
the current generation timer

simplesect.para: the number of individuals to sample at this location.

briefdescription.para: Removes the old position within active by checking any wrapping and removing connections.

detaileddescription.para: The function also corrects the linked list to identify the correct nwrap for every wrapped lineage in that space.

parameterdescription.para: the desired active reference to remove from the grid.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the move, given a start x,y coordinates and wrapping.

detaileddescription.para: The provided parameters will be altered to contain the new values so no record of the old variables remains after function running. Current dispersal methods use a fattailed dispersal.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the minmax for a given branch.

detaileddescription.para: Calculates the speciation rate required for speciation to have occured on this branch.

parameterdescription.para: the current active reference to perform calculations over.

memberdef.argsstring: (bool &coal, const unsigned long &chosen, unsigned long &coalchosen, const long &oldx, const long &oldy, const long &oldxwrap, const long &oldywrap)
memberdef.name: calcNewPos

briefdescription.para: Calculates the new position, checking whether coalescence has occured and with which lineage.

detaileddescription.para: This involves correct handling of checking wrapped lineages (outside the original grid). The probability of coalescence is also calculated.

parameterdescription.para: boolean for whether coalescence occured or not
the chosen lineage
the lineaged that is coalescing (if required)
the old x position
the old y position
the old x wrapping
the old y wrapping

briefdescription.para: Switches the chosen position with the endactive position.

parameterdescription.para: the chosen lineage to switch with endactive.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the next step for the simulation.
Estimates the species number from the second largest minimum speciation rate remaining in active.

detaileddescription.para:
This allows for halting of the simulation once this threshold has been reached. However, the function is not currently in use as calculating the coalescence tree is very computionally intensive. Deprecated
this function is currently obselete and not implemented, but was still functional as of version 3.2

briefdescription.para: Increments the generation counter and step references, then updates the map for any changes to habitat cover.
Updates the coalescence variables in the step object.
Expands the map, generating the new lineages where necessary.

detaileddescription.para: The samplemask provided is used for expansion. Any empty spaces are filled with a new lineage. Lineages which have not moved are changed to tips, with a new data entry so that original and new generations are recorded.

parameterdescription.para: the generation that the expansion is occuring at. This is used in recording the new tips

briefdescription.para: Creates a string containing the SQL insertion statement for the simulation parameters.

simplesect.para: string containing the SQL insertion statement

briefdescription.para: Pause the simulation and dump data from memory.
Saves the map object to file.

parameterdescription.para: the output file stream to save the object to

briefdescription.para: Saves the grid object to file.

parameterdescription.para: the output file stream to save the object to

briefdescription.para: Resumes the simulation from a previous state.

detaileddescription.para: Reads in the parameters and objects from file and re-starts the simulation.

briefdescription.para: Loads the grid from the save file into memory.

simplesect.para: Requires that both the simulation parameters and the maps have already been loaded.

briefdescription.para: Loads the map from the save file into memory.

simplesect.para: Requires that the simulation parameters have already been loaded.

briefdescription.para: Checks that the reproduction map makes sense with the fine density map.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned long numstart, long x, long y)
memberdef.name: addWrappedLineage

briefdescription.para: Adds the lineage to the correct point in the linked list of active lineages.

parameterdescription.para: the active position to add
the x position of the lineage
the y position of the lineage

memberdef.argsstring: (const long &x, const long &y, const long &xwrap, const long &ywrap, const double &generationin, vector< TreeNode > &data_added)
memberdef.name: countCellExpansion

briefdescription.para: Counts the number of lineages at a particular location that need to be added, after making the correct proportion of those that already exist into tips.

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate of the location of interest
the y coordinate of the location of interest
the x wrapping of the location
the y wrapping of the location
the generation to assign to new tips
vector containing TreeNode objects to add to data

simplesect.para: the number of lineages still to add

memberdef.argsstring: (long x, long y, long x_wrap, long y_wrap, double generation_in, unsigned long add, vector< TreeNode > &data_added, vector< DataPoint > &active_added)
memberdef.name: expandCell

briefdescription.para: Expands the cell at the desired location by adding the supplied number of lineages.

detaileddescription.para: This takes into account wrapping to correctly add the right number

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate to add at
the y coordinate to add at
the x wrapping to add at
the y wrapping to add at
the generation to set the new lineages to
the total number of lineages to add at this location

briefdescription.para: Import the simulation variables from the command line structure.

detaileddescription.para: This function parses the simulation variables, imports them from the config file, checks that the input files exist and checks for any paused simulations. The flags are then set correctly, meaning that setup() and runSimulation() can be run immediately afterwards.

parameterdescription.para: the path to the config file containing parameters to parse.

briefdescription.para: Import the simulation variables from a ConfigOption.

detaileddescription.para: This function parses the simulation variables, imports them (from either the command line or a config file), checks that the input files exist and checks for any paused simulations. The flags are then set correctly, meaning that setup() and runSim() can be run immediately afterwards.

parameterdescription.para: the set of config parameters to import

briefdescription.para: Resets all the simulation variables.
Sets up the simulation parameters from the one provided.

detaileddescription.para:
Intended for usage with metacommunity application. No output directory is expected.
sim_parameters_in
the simulation parameters to set up the simulation with

briefdescription.para: Asserts that the output directory is not null and exists. If it doesn't exist, it attempts to create it.

parameterdescription.para: if the output directory creation fails

simplesect.para: true if output creates successfully

briefdescription.para: Checks for existing paused simulations to resume from Sets bPaused if there are.

detaileddescription.para: This version uses the default values read from the config file.

briefdescription.para: Checks for existing paused simulations to resume from.

detaileddescription.para: Sets bPaused if there are.
This version uses the values supplied to the function directly

parameterdescription.para: the output directory to check for
the seed for paused sims
the job_type for paused sims

briefdescription.para: Sets the protracted variables.

parameterdescription.para: the minimum number of generations to have passed before speciation is allowed
the maximum number of generations a lineage can exist for before it is speciated.

briefdescription.para: Gets the has_paused variable for resuming sims.

simplesect.para: if the simulation has paused

briefdescription.para: Gets the map autocorrel times.
Getter for the simulation seed.

simplesect.para: Returns the seed

briefdescription.para: Gets the job type for the simulation. This is a reference number for the jobs.

simplesect.para: Returns the job type

briefdescription.para: Sets the simulation seed for the random number generator.

detaileddescription.para: This function should only be called once.
The seed is set within the NR object. This will be fixed for the simulation and is only performed once.

parameterdescription.para: the desired seed to set for the simulation

briefdescription.para: Sets the sizes of grid, active and data, based on the number of individuals counted from the samplemask.

simplesect.para: a count of the number of individuals that exist in the simulation

briefdescription.para: Sets the starting values for required parameters.
Sets the variables at the start of a simulation for temporary data.

detaileddescription.para: This is not the main set-up routine, which creates the permanent data structures including maps, the coalescence tree and active lineage listings.

briefdescription.para: Prints the statement for the setup initiation.

detaileddescription.para: This is stored in a separate function so that it can be called in isolation by child classes.

briefdescription.para: Sets the temporal sampling points from the time config file.
Determines the speciation rates to apply and then applies them to the coalescence tree post-simulation.

detaileddescription.para: Detects speciation rates from the config files supplied.

briefdescription.para: Adds the speciation rates to those to be applied.
Assigns the objects sizes in memory and fills with the starting lineages.
Run the entire simulation given the start conditions already defined by setup()

detaileddescription.para: Setup is assumed to have been run already. This function is the main function containing the main loop of the simulation. At the end of the simulation, returns true if the simulation is complete, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Writes to the console that the simulation is beginning.
Write the step counter to console. This function should only be called in debugging mode.
Chooses a random lineage from active.

detaileddescription.para: The index of the random lineage is stored in this_step, as chosen. Also records the required variables for the step process, like x, y position.

briefdescription.para: Speciation to supplied lineage.

detaileddescription.para:
Also calls the removeOldPos() and switchPositions() functions for removing the lineage out of active reference.
chosen

briefdescription.para: Performs the actual speciation.

parameterdescription.para: the position in the array of TreeNodes for this lineage

briefdescription.para: Perform the coalescence between lineages. Once coalesced, lineages are removed from the active scope.

the target lineage for coalscence

briefdescription.para: Checks if the number of lineages should be expanded at another sample point.
Randomly checks if a lineage should be added, based on the proportion added.

simplesect.para: true if the lineage should be added, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Checks the size of the main active and data objects is large enough.

the required active object size

the generation to set for the new lineage
vector of lineages to add to data

briefdescription.para: Finalises the simulation, and performs the correct tasks depending if the sim has been paused or finished.
Applies the given speciation rate to the tree.

the required time of speciation

briefdescription.para: Overloaded version of applySpecRates for the default generation (0.0).

briefdescription.para: Applies the given speciation rate to the tree, but does not output to a file. Instead returns a pointer to the nodes object.

the required time of speciation

briefdescription.para: Gets the sorted cumulative species abundances from the contained TreeList.

For use with metacommunity applications
row of cumulative species abundances

briefdescription.para: Sets up Community member to point to the same output database as the simulation.

simplesect.para: the protracted speciation parameters to set up

briefdescription.para: Sets up the generation of the tree object.

parameterdescription.para: the required speciation rate
the required time of speciation

briefdescription.para: Applies multiple speciation rates to the coalescence tree, ignoring repeated speciation rates.

detaileddescription.para: Speciation rates are read from the speciation_rates object, which should have already been calculated.

briefdescription.para: Gets the protractedness of the simulation. Overridden by protracted child classes.
Gets the protracted variables and returns them as a single, newline separated string. This method is intended to be overridden in derived classes.

simplesect.para: string containing the protracted variables, separated by newlines.

briefdescription.para: Gets the minimum number of generations a lineage must exist.

detaileddescription.para:
Without overriding this function, should always return 0.0.
double the number of generations a lineage must exist

briefdescription.para: Gets the maximum number of generations a lineage can exist.

detaileddescription.para: Without overriding this function, should always return 0.0 (no maximum).

simplesect.para: double the number of generations a lineage must exist

briefdescription.para: Copy the in-memory database to file.

detaileddescription.para: This function should not be called if the database is already opened on disc, and won't do anything if it is.

briefdescription.para: Creates the output data objects and outputs important simulation data to a database file.
Outputs the simulation data (including the coalescence tree) to an sql database.
Sort and process the species list so that the useful information can be extracted from it.
Writes the times to the terminal for simulation information.
Opens a connection to the in-memory database, or the on-disk database, depending on the compilation options.
Generates the SQL database file from the full simulation data. This allows for greater analysis of the data after completion of the simulation.
Creates the output directory, if it doesn't already exist, and deletes any existing database with the output name.
Creates the SIMULATION_PARAMETERS table in the SQL database.
Outputs the protracted variables to a string.

detaileddescription.para: This function is intended to be overridden by derived classes. It is intended the output is used for writing to SQL databases.

simplesect.para: string containing a list of the protracted speciation variables.

briefdescription.para: Checks the output folder exists and initiates the pause.

briefdescription.para: Completes the pause routine and outputs the sql dump.

Checks for resuming and prints to the terminal.
